Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Adebrogan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, the room was pretty basic but had everything that was needed. The room was small with just enough room to get in and out of bed but comfy enough for a good nights sleep. Location was excellent and will definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good evening.In fact it was great except first night,when it was loud in the street and i couldn't get asleep. Staff was very professional,they changed towels and tissue regularly. Nice breakfast,tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traspin Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vijaya a few days ago, it wasn't The Ritz, but for the price we paid it was adequate for what we wanted (somewhere to put our head down at the end of the day!) After climbing the spiral staircase (so funny after having a few drinks! Our double room overlooked one of the canals and was it was lovely having all the hustle and bustle right outside our very high up window! It was a bit of a squeeze-however, it served it's purpose. The room was clean, the towels were changed during our 3 night stay and it was nice to have our own bathroom, even if we did have to navigate our way past the toilet to get to the sink and shower (pretty squashed). The reception staff were really helpful/friendly and it was open 24hours. The breakfast was pretty pants! the only option was bread/toast (when the toaster was working) cheese, ham, boiled eggs, orange juice and coffee. I would definitely go back and stay again (have already been looking at prices for our next trip!) If you book, enjoy the stay, if you want 5 star accommodation, book 5 star accommodation. :))

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: LEIVADITI P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: + it is a cheap hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. The location was very good and the people working at the hotel were very kind. Strongly recommended for a low budget vacations. - It is a very old building with several problems.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in better hotels in Amsterdam, we had mice :(”
Reviews.Author: Kim W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mice in room! little bit scary but we were moved to a mouse free room- good breakfast, great location, nice big rooms, clean bathroom, and common areas, but we had visitors of mice at night and the front rooms are so noisy you cant sleep! ...

Reviews.Title: “Review of Vijaya Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at Hotel Vijaya very much, at first I wasn't impressed with the room however once you settle down and put all your stuff in the room it becomes very cosy. The bed was so comfortable, myself and my partner had the most stunning view over-looking the canal which was lovely to look onto. The hotel staff were ever so friendly and always willing to offer advice which was comforting. The best thing about staying at Hotel Vijaya was the location, it was right next to everything such as brilliant shops, coffee shops, red light district, central station etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Gary W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in an Excellent location, Great value for money, would recommend all the time, we have used this hotel for over 7 years. Breakfast is ok as far as continental breakfasts go, Chimes from church bells can sometimes wake you so ensure you have a good drink or smoke before going to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Liudmila”
Reviews.Author: Lyudmila M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected: very close to cenral station, nice canal view, private clean bathroom. But my room was on the first floor just over some noisy bar. Friday and Saturday night it was impossible to sleep because of incredibly loud music until the bar was closed late after midnight. And the most annoing was that hotel chaged my card 75 euros when i booked online 2 days before arrivel. Upon check-in i payed cash and when i asked about those 75 euros i was told the hotel keep them for garantee and refund in 30 days! I dont understand what garantee they want after i payed and left. I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: B G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent,couldn't be better to be honest! We overlooked the canal so couldn't really have asked for more. We were greeted by the friendliest receptionist & were impressed with the staff throughout our stay,couldn't fault them. The hotel was as clean as it could be really,just a bit shabby and dated.The bathroom & bedroom were spotless and beds were made/towels changed daily. The room wasn't big by any stretch of the imagination,but was excellent value,despite the steep winding staircase to get there!!Were in Amsterdam after all,the buildings ate tall! Breakfast was pleasant-good juice and coffee,toast,cheese,meat etc-again,basic,but good!! We would definitely return,but would be sure to ask for a canal view

Reviews.Title: “Significantly Below Average”
Reviews.Author: liambr
Reviews.Content: Visited the Hotel Vijaya recently and was very dissapointed. After checking in and paying on arrival we trekked up the rickety staircases with soiled carpets to our room. Several flights of small stairs later we arrived at our room, which did have a nice view, but was very cold and dank. Covers were dirty and moth eaten, and the grotty bathroom was not very nice at all. Clearly the owners pay no attention to detail whatsoever - lots of tiny things that you would expect from a 21st century hotel are missing. To the credit of the staff, they were friendly and did offer help, but this alone is not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - shocking.”
Reviews.Author: Urbanprojectz
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam for the 5th time, stayed at this hotel before a few years ago. I remember the location was good - but this place was so shocking. The room we had didn't have a working shower. Most people in this hotel were too stoned to complain. We had a room which was damp and damaged, TV didn't work, 2 plugs didn't work - the shower was broken. We went out dei king to a few bars and clubs and met some girls - they wouldn't let my friend and I bring them to the room! They asked for 25 euros per guest even though they weren't sleeping. The guy then asked if we could get him a girl, we told him they were not prostitutes!! The next day we left I asked for a refund for the next 3 nights as the room was shocking - he refused to give over any money. I said I would call the police and as I did, he agreed to give me back 2 days - we went for a walk about 15 minutes found a hotel which was accommodating let us bring guests and treated us with respect. I find Dutch people to be so pleasent and during my visits I make many friends but this place is just embarrassing! Most hotels are only a short walk from red light don't fall victim of this joke of a place!

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel with a good location in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Aussie21
Reviews.Content: unfortunately we booked our accommodation 1 week before going to amseterdam and accommodation gets pretty hard to find and this hotel managed to have 1 bedroom with 3 single beds. So when i booked the accommodation it was 210 EU a night so then it was 420 EU for the 2 nights. In general you can get this cheaper if you book in advance. THe hotel itself is pretty close of the amsterdam terminal which you can take from amsterdam airport and was about 20 mins. From the Amsterdam train terminal to the hotel, its about a 10-15 min walk which is alright. When you get to the hotel, theres a small desk as the reception and because we came early, our room wasn't available but was free to leave our luggage next to the wall and could see other people also left their luggages as well too. I paid for the accommodation as the online booking doesn't charge your credit card but only assume they would if you didn't check into the hotel. Because I was using a CC, they had to charge extra which was really annoying. We went out and came back to our room. We originally had 3 single beds but they asked if they could take the other bed and we said that was fine. They had put the 2 single beds put together and i don't think the room could of had a 3rd bed but anyway. The room itself was ok, a kettle wasn't included, and in the shower, there was a tube for the soap so don't expect them to provide any shower amenities. The beds were ok and we were next to the river side so could hear the resturants and so forth but wasn't an issue during our stay. For the breakfast, basically theres downstairs room which is where the reception is and there is a big table. The food supplied was just bread, boiled eggs, some meat slices to put on your bread with butter, nutella & strawberry jams. The location of the hotel is really good as it is in the central district and down the road from the infamous red light district. Across the bridge from the hotel, you can walk up and it would be chinatown. Overall the hotel was ok but for the price and if you book alot earlier, I would have gone to another hotel for a better room & better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: Went here back in April 2011. The location was great in the centre of all the action. The room were adequate with shower and toilet. The room and bathroom is cleaned and made everyday with fresh owls. The room was cosy and we over looked the canel. As you are near the pubs it can get loud but hey this is Amsterdam so didn't bother us too much. Staff were ok gave us some maps etc which was good. This isnt a hotel but for the price you cannot moan. I will be returning again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lousy staff.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart L
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently when my usual hotel was full. Central location. Nice, if basic, freshly decorated room, reasonably comfy bed. Ordinary breakfast of bread, cold meat, cheese etc. The guy at the desk was a sarcastic, unhelpful pain in the backside, joking that they had no rooms when I arrived (with a reservation) and kept up the pretence until I got annoyed with him. Customer service is obviously not a priority here. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki A
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start with this awful hotel. Maybe with the plus points which will be much quicker to say...the location is superb, right on the edge of the red light district. That's where the plus points end. The guy on reception was very cold and unfriendly. Our room was right at the top up some narrow stairs (fine for us but could be awkward for elderly people)...the bigger problem for us than the stairs was the fact that the window in our room was hanging off when we tried to open it! It looked very dangerous and looked like it could've fallen onto myself or my boyfriend. We spoke to reception about it and were told somebody would look at it....if this even happened nothing was done about it. When the window was open, the room was filled with the smell of curry permanently due to the Indian restaurant in the hotel. Now I like curry, but it's not a smell you want to be always filling your nostrils, particularly when you have just woken up. There was a fan in the room which we figured we could use so as to keep the dangerous window closed and help keep the curry smell out, as it was August and very hot.... when we got close to it, it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a VERY long time and I wouldn't even turn it on in the end at the risk of getting showered by dust. When I got an even closer look, I saw a few insects sitting in the spokes of it?!?! I presumed they were dead, but when I woke up with bites on my arms I can't be too sure! I visited a chemist when I got home and was informed that they were mosquito bites. Yes, this hotel is cheap by Amsterdam standards (certainly not by International standards) and I know you get what you pay for. I've stayed in many cheap hotels and hostels around the world, and am more than happy with a basic room just for somewhere to sleep, but compared to other cheap places, this is appalling. The rooms are a decent size, the bed was comfortable enough, the bathroom was small but fine, but I don't expect to find insects in a filthy fan, bites all up my arms after staying, unhelpful staff and a dangerous window that could've seriously injured us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: DaveTheBear1967
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Vijaya whenever I visit Amsterdam - the reason? It's close to the station, the rooms are clean and ensuite, there's a basic but good breakfast buffet (cold meats, cheeses, bread, cereals, juice etc), they will store your luggage if you're checking in early or checking out late and don't want to carry bags around with you all day, and the staff are really friendly. The most important things for me are the private shower/toilet facilities and its closeness to all the action - and it's at a lower price than many of the more basic shared facility hotels and hostels! As with most all the hotels in Amsterdam, there are stairs! It can get a bit noisy if your room overlooks the canal and the room is booked over a weekend, say... but I always carry earplugs just in case! If, like me, you want a good, basic and secure room to retire to after a long day and night enjoying all Amsterdam has to offer, then look no further. There was a little flatscreen TV in the room last time I was there, but to be honest, I don't go to Amsterdam to sit in my hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: carlos_e_sofia
Reviews.Content: so we arrived early eveneing, coming out the central station and having printed the map on their web site, we found the hotel pretty easyly. You really can't miss it. the guy on the front desk quickly checked us in and gave us a city map with all the tips he could recall. Having arrived at our room, just above the reception, we were delighted with the canal view. this is a 5 bed-room with a bunk bed. (Room nÂº8) Lots of free walking space. But... at 3 am, one of us was woken by busy bed bugs and one of us went down stairs to complain. The on call guy camy up and changes the sheets, arguing it might be mosquitos (yeah, right, had i not read the TA reviews...) then in the morning when we were leaving, the guy that checked us in asked if we had had any inconvenience during the night and would we like to change rooms. We said yes, and were assigned a new one on the spot (Room nÂº9, one floor up - a 4 bed room on which was added a spare bed... meaning... almost no walking space, but much newer room). This room was ok, but no view, and in the morning we could hear the noise coming from the repairs being done on the Our Lord in The Attic chuch, which is exactly 2 doors down. (i think they share the same court yard or something. they were quite near our window). this room is in front of the stairs, but since there is a double door, you can hardly hear anything from the ppl passing by, only if they are really noisy.... on our 4th night we were to change to a 4 bed room, as one of our friends was leaving, but we could stay in this room for one more night. although, on the last night, we did have to move to the 4 bed room which was assigned to us. and this meant... going up another floor!!! (Room nÂº14, 13 steep stairs highter!!!!) again, inside view but overseeing the a'dam rooftops :) and sunset too. Beware of the huge bathroom window, or neighbours will see you shower and... well... doing everything else! As for the breakfast, basic but ok. You can eat all you want. No fruit which was a down for me, since i dont take dairies... but orange juice and cafe did it for that week. Location... is the best.... close to the train station, close to the dam rak for transports (but far eneugh to dont hear the noise) in the Red light, even if you're just there for a laugh! Lots of pubs, coffee shops, sex shops in the area. Some super markets and souvernir shops as well. Yellow bike is just arround the corner and busy canal in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average budget hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SHTS
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an exellent location rigth at the red light district and very near to the central station. The room was tiny and had the steepest steps ever but it was ok to stay 3 nights. Even thought it was middle of the action it was very quiet. The breakfast was simple but ok.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY DEPRESSING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: float223
Reviews.Content: recently got back from a 3 night stay in the vijaya. still gob-smacked at the price. 120 euros a night for a triple room. when entering reception we were told to go away and come back 3 times whilst the room was being made up. this was after the receptionist had sat on his phone ignoring me for the best part of 10 minutes. (nice welcome). then we walked through the labyrinth of stairs and corridors treading over piles of toilet paper, boxes of allsorts and decorating gear. (god knows if the carpets have ever seen a vac). when entering our room we were presented with an over-powering stench of bleach, to which one of my mates commented "something bads happened in here" which made me chuckle. i tried to make light of the fact we'd been diddled on the price, but looking at the grease and grime smeared walls, central heating pipes hanging out the walls and windows that were just bolted together with odd bits of rotting wood it was hard to feel anything but sorrow. the breakfast is basically a tray of cheese, a tray of ham, and a loaf of bread. i asked the the guy in the room to put it in the brevel behind him to make it into a toastie. he barked "you want it warming?" like i'd asked him to decorate my house for free. he ripped it out my hand and threw it onto the machine. i just left at that point.... unbelievable noise from the street ending around 2am and starting up around 7.30am again so if you've gone for a relaxing break you aint gonna get one. all in all probably one of the worst hotels ive stayed in (and ive been to blackpool enough as a young lad). for the price i'd look anywhere but here. avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: passenger_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a perfect location, parallel to the street red light district and only 450 meters away from the central station. Upon arrival at the reception were to calculate an additional 15 euros that are not explained. The restaurant is in the reception, in the morning is sometimes difficult to find a place for breakfast. The room is small but clean, a bit noisy at night ... Good hotel for travelers who dont want to spend a lot of money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: JamesNcharlotte
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed four nights in lower level room. Hotel was very easy to walk to from train station. Staff was nice and helpful. Room, luckily was on the ground floor. Stairs looked as if they could have been a challenge with bags. Room was clean and comfortable. Clean towels daily. Breakfast was ok, nothing fancy, large group tables, no private dinning. Couldnt have been happier with the location. Easy to get everything. Will stay there again, hopefully very, very soon.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: adeappo
Reviews.Content: me and my mates stayed for three nites in a four bed room,2 singles and a bunk bed,there was lots of space in the room, the room had a view over the canal,we never had breki,the room was dated but clean and fresh towels everyday,the bathroom was huge, the hotel is on the edge of the red light area nr the church,i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night or two.”
Reviews.Author: janicamachado
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my sister for only one night. We had a twin room with ensuite bathroom and breakfast included. Positive points: Although in the red light district, the ambience is great. Very good location. Nice view to a canal. The street was not as noisy as expected. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was fresh, though not much to choose from and the breakfast room is small. Our room and bathroom were very clean. The bathroom was spacious enough. The beds were very comfy! Now the negative stuff: The hallways are filthy. The hotel itself is like a labyrinth! We had to get some help to found our room. The twin room looks like a corridor. It was a bit of a hot night, so we had to use the little fan on the nightstand, which meant we couldnÂ´t have the tv on, since there was only one plug! DonÂ´t know if the tv even worked, since we never turned it on. Free internet included, but very slow. After a while I gave up! The toilet flush made wierd noises and took 15 min or more to fill up! They gave us only 2 towels. The shower had no pressure at all and it didnÂ´t have some kind of a shelf to put your stuff while taking a shower. I had to put shampoo, shower gel, etc, on the shower floor! I think we payed too much for what we got but from what I hear low budget hotels in amsterdam have poor conditions. ItÂ´s good for a couple of nights just to have a bed to sleep on. If returning to Amsterdam, will find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Karen154945
Reviews.Content: Although the room was clean, the overall decor was old and tired. A tad over priced. Be prepared to walk up very narrow, steep and winding staircases to get to you room. Centrally located in the red light district, so within walking distance of all of the local tourist attractions. Reception was friendly, but breakfast was NOT worth the extra money we paid. Lots of street noise at night - but hey - it's Amsterdam! Good place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Probably unlikely to find a nicer budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TillieNat
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends were a bit wary of staying here, as it's described as two star and had mixed reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The decor wasn't amazing, but for what we paid we were impressed - the bathroom was cleaned daily, we had comfortable beds, and the man on reception was friendly. The only thing that we didn't know before going was that the hotel was in the middle of the Red Light District, but we didn't have any noise problems and never felt unsafe, so this isn't too much of an issue. Dam Square, the station, and a lot of the main tourist attractions (although if you want to do the Van Gogh and Anne Frank museums then it's best to get the canal cruise/tram, as we were shattered after walking it!). The breakfast was basic but filling, and we found the rolls particularly useful to keep hold of for lunchtime. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wants a cheap and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location! but only good for 1 night!”
Reviews.Author: TarynF
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great location. basicly right in the red light district! double room was quite nice! but a bit noisy because u can hear everything from the street. but the ensuite bathroom was tiny and a big person will not fit inside there! u sit on the toilet with the wall against your knees. breakfast was that bad. just ham, cheese and bread. but otherwise the staff are really helpful! everything was nice and clean.the hotel is not bad for the price and location. great for 1 or 2 nights! must better than staying at a hostel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - that's it”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjarocin
Reviews.Content: Location is the best advantage of this place. Price is very high as it is in general in this area of Amsterdam. You would expect more but it is probably similar all way around. Next time I would take hotel further away from the centre and travel by bicycle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: aleka333
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and loved how close everything was. Never had to use a tram at all and explored all parts of the city. Hotel is in the always interesting red light district, but is completely safe and adequate. It's quite old and yes, there's a steep staircase but we anticipated all that for most budget motels across Europe. Our room was smoky - cigarette smoky - though it is advertised as nonsmoking. It overlooked the canal with a nice view though. The bedspread was disgusting and stained, so we asked for a new one which has slightly less stains on it. Bathroom looked like an afterthought - you could barely walk between the toilet and the wall to get to the sink & shower - and we're thin normal-sized people. Showerhead was rusty and old, needing replacement. We didn't want to touch it for fear of tetanus or worse, haha. Breakfast was basic but free. Though we researched it online, we didn't know about the policy of turning in your keys while out. This was the only hotel in the eight countries across Europe we visited that asked us to turn in our key while we were out for the day. When we tried to avoid it, having heard many horror stories of rooms getting robbed, the manager got all defensive and lectured us endlessly about how it was for OUR security. Well, the only way I feel secure is to hold onto my own hotel key. He also said it was so we wouldn't have to pay for it if we lost it. What are we, complete morons? It's all fine and good if they want to have a policy like this, I just think it should be announced upon booking. And we really didn't appreciate having this insecure manager waste a good bit of our time lecturing us and defending the security of his staff, etc. Not to mention he took a jab at us being Americans - by saying we're used to crime & not being able to trust anyone. We'll most definitely be bargain-shopping at a different hotel next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “a home from home”
Reviews.Author: Lynne-Widnes
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was ideally placed for getting around (near to Central Station and so very handy for trams and trains) and we were able to get around a lot of areas. The staff at the Vijaya were friendly and attentative and made us feel welcome. Breakfast was only continental but really fresh and was replenished as soon as anything ran out. The bedrooms are basic but clean and the en-suite bathroom was a bonus. On the negative side it can be very noisy when other guests run up and down the stairs at 4am but that says more about the bad manners of the guests than it does about the hotel! I would definately stay here again and consider it an absolute bargain

Reviews.Title: “We arrived at this hotel and expected...”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and expected bed-bugs after seeing the room. No beauty with no view. The bed was ok the bathroom small. Amsterdam seems to totally lack decent hotels centrally at reasonable prices. It's with this in mind that I WOULD recommend this. The location is on the edge of the RLD, nothing is too far away. If you're looking for something nice expect to pay over Â£150 a night. Don't expect much from the rooms though...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: TyroneGal
Reviews.Content: Its not a fancy place but was in a great location, had our own bathroom facilities which were clean and the beds were comfy! We found the staff very helpful and willing to accommodate any requests. We were a group of 5 girls aged 24-26 and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Location EXCELLENT. Hotel condition POOR”
Reviews.Author: lacost69
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights at the Vijaya as part of a Stag Do trip. Found the hotel quite easily from Centraal Station. Tried to check in at 10:30am but was way too early so was told to come back in 2 hours. The hotel kept our bags for us while we went out. Left near to reception but didn't seem entirely secure so don't leave money or passports etc in. As you walk into the hotel their is a 'restaurant'/reception area. The hotel isn't dirty as such but it extremely worn and old in every single way and area. very run down and needs some paint and carpets. We stayed in a 5 bed room on the top floor. It was a long way up and the last flight of stairs was extremely steep and narrow. the room was beyond basic. Five single beds, a 'wardrobe' that was barely holding itself together, a tv strapped to the wall, and a wet room. Extremely heavy window opened out onto the rooftops, poor view! Never had breakfast. One of our group passed by breakfast one morning and said it basically consisted of eggs and ham and cheese etc. We instead eat out at the local Bulldog cafe which was a nice full English. Had fresh towels every day. The shower was poor and at times almost just dripped out and went hot and cold. They didn't seem to do much to clean up, one of our group dropped his chips on the floor and didn't realise he had done it as they were down the side of his bed...they were still there the day we left as was the rubbish we had accumulated and left inside and beside the bin during our stay. Maybe we could have been cleaner ourselves but you would expect things to be cleaned up. Hotel key was handed into reception when going out so that was a good thing and someone was always there no matter what time it was. The best thing about the hotel was the location. Extremely close to Centraal Station and based in the Red Light District. Across the canal from it all. Plenty of bars, shops, restaurants and late night takeaways are all on the doorstep. We mainly used the Bulldog Cafe which was the cheapest pint of lager we could find at 4 euros. Overall, the hotel was quite friendly and seemed quite safe but it definitely needs a lick of paint and some money spending on it. I wouldn't recommend it to couples wanting something decent but to a group of lads it was fine as it was a bed, it was cheap and it was in a superb location. However, if we did return then maybe we would look around at other alternatives. The location and price was the hotels best feature without a shadow of a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Original Amsterdam and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Mario796
Reviews.Content: In my review I describe the hotel but I also emphasize the surrounding area. The Hotel Vijaya is on one of the original canals cut in Amsterdam. It is a two-minute walk to the first major church built there in the 13th Century, the "Old Church" (Oude Kerk). Next to the Vijaya is a hidden church from the 17th century---something to do with the "Restoration," which is I think when the authorities allowed Catholics to openly worship again...I'm a little hazy on the history. BUT-----the hidden church is called Our Lord in the Attic (Ons Lieve Heer op de Solder), known now as the MUSEUM AMSTELKRING. Go inside and up to the top floor and you will be amazed at what you see: a small church all the trappings-----ornate alter and pulpit, pipe organ, choir, rows of seating, baptistries, side chapels, confessionals, marble holy water fonts, statuary, and views over the City of Amsterdam. One block to the west of the Vijaya on OZ Voorgburgwal is Warmoe Straat, one of the oldest streets in Amsterdam. A couple of blocks to the east is Nieuwemarkt and the Waag, formerly part of the city's fortifications. The street signs around Nieuwemarkt are in Dutch and Chinese---this is Amsterdam's "Chinatown." There is a beautiful temple midway down Zeedijk south of Nieuwemarkt. About a ten minute walk from the hotel is the Spui, where Spuistraat, Nieuwezijds Voorbuurgwal and Singel converge. The area surrounding The Spui dates from the 17th Century. The hotel itself is "tainted ornate." It has the original staircase with a beautifully carved handrail and steep stairs. In the lobby and breakfast room are large gold-framed ceiling plaques. But I describe the hotel as "tainted ornate" because the handrail is chipped or scratched in spots although it is very sturdy; the ceiling designs look a bit faded from age. Inside the bedrooms, the tainted ornate look persists. The bedding and window treatments are dark plaids, the wall frescoes are faded, and the windows seem to be the original very heavy affairs that are hard to open. The good part is that they CAN be opened to let in some fresh air. Rooms are small. Two of us got a triple room so we could have some extra space. There were one or two chairs of the outdoor patio seating variety that you see used for outside seating at cafes and restaurants. There was no writing table, only a couple of nightstands, one of which served as the TV stand. There was an armoir for our clothes and no drawers. I stayed on other occasions in a single room which was very narrow. However, there was always enough hot water for a shower and the TV worked. One down side is that you must remember to close the door properly as they don't close automatically. Don't just walk out the room and let the door close or it will stay unlocked. Many Amsterdam hotels are a combination of several houses linked internally by hallways and stairways. The Hotel Vijaya follows suit; getting to your room can be an adventure and it can seem like you are going through a maze to reach your room. It's fun! If your room faces the canal, you'll hear late night noise from the Trinity Tavern. If you're on vacation, don't worry about it. Join the fun, have a few pints yourself, and relax--you'll sleep fine. If you're awakened by a band of drunken revelers singing in the area, don't worry about it. Enjoy it for a moment then go back to sleep. If you're NOT on vacation however, get a room that doesn't face the canal. Go to the Oude Kerk to hear a free concert on Sundays. Catch the tram to the Concertgebouw for a free lunchtime concert on Wednesdays. Walk to the station and catch a train for a day trip to Den Haag, Leeuwarden, Nijmegen, Delft, Utrecht, Amersfoort or De Hoge Veluwe, to name a few. If you're driving, the whole country is at your disposal. Find some windmills or castles, or motor through the tulip and flower region. The station is only a five-minute walk. Dam Square is five minutes away. Stop in at Wynand Fockink, in an alley next to the Krasnapolsky) to taste some genever. There are other proeflokaals in the neighborhood. I staed at the Vijaya in 2008 and 2009. In 2009 their wifi was working and I must say it was much faster than my cable connection at home in San Francisco. I don't go to Amsterdam to surf the web but having wifi available is a valuable resource for getting travel information and making plans for your day. I heard something about buying tickets online for the Rijksmuseum----buy your entry ticket online and you will avoid the long queues outside the museum. I appreciated that breakfast was included in the room price. The breakfast was adequate and it helps get you off to a good start on your day. There are plenty of opportunities to get snacks in the area. There's a Febo automat across the canal from the hotel, and behind Dam Square is a Albert Heijn supermarket. On one of the alleys between Damrak and Nieuwendijk there is a "vishandel" (fish shop) at Zoutsteeg 6, where you can get fried fish, smoked fish, raw herring ("Nieuew Haring") and other seafood along with bread and a beverage. Beverages cost extra. The best thing about this hotel is its central location. There's limited car traffic on the street below and the main noise is from humans, not vehicle engines. Additionally, you're minutes away from seeing sexy women, practically naked, as you walk down the street. They are legal sex providers and many of them are really hot. If you feel uncomfortable seeing them just look the other way. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Best location for RLD/coffee shops & great spot for intercity travelling”
Reviews.Author: fleeginfloggin
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the other feedbacks. This hotel was great. The beds were made EVERY day, towels changed, rooms cleaned and a nice included breakfast to boot! The staff was very friendly and gave excellent travelling advise. The location is perfect for those using the centraal station to sight see during the day, and enjoy the RLD and niewmarkt scenes at night. If you got to bed at 9pm or have children go somewhere else. The stairs are steep but manageable if you don't have a huge suitcase. If you are travelling on a budget and wish to be in the heart of amsterdam, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly. Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamTimmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and really enjoyed it. The hotel is basic, but clean and friendly. We have visited amsterdam on a number of occasions and this has been the best hotel by far for the price. Double rooms were spacious and came with a private bathroom. No tea and coffee facilities is the only bad thing we can say. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Slap bang in the heart of the "action"”
Reviews.Author: Nopicnic
Reviews.Content: If your looking for somewhere in Amsterdam that is in easy reach of ALL the differing attractions,this is it! Three minutes,flat' walk from Central Station,on the edge of the Red Light District and two minute walk to all sorts of transport around the City. The rooms are not exactly lavish but are clean and tidy,beds made and rooms cleaned every day,TV with some English channels, en-suite (mostly),the usual continental breakfast,wake up calls and the staff are helpful. This **star hotel is all you need for a good old knees up in Amsterdam. Prices vary from season to season (as usual in Ams.) and are very reasonable. I've been travelling to Amsterdam for Donkey's years and have found no other place comparable.. Although not for the person looking for a pampering this Hotel offers everything you could need for a good old knees-up in the "DAM". Have Fun!!

Reviews.Title: “it is not actually a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Akramdash
Reviews.Content: Single room is very tiny, the bathroom is out of the room , overpriced concerning the quality. The Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, in the heart of Red District”
Reviews.Author: aniri406
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here, but only for sleep. The quad room was clean. Good breakfast. The location is brilliant, just in the Red District, 5-7 min on foot by Dam Square and 5 min by train station + Tourist Information. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “terriable hotel”
Reviews.Author: 24BC
Reviews.Content: not worth 55euro a night.. digusting hotel, very dirty.. reception was helpful though, friendly, but not worth 55euro a night... i left after one day.. good location though,, but if you are a clean person, this is not the place for you..

Reviews.Title: “WARNING ! Very bad single room.”
Reviews.Author: ScreenName01091
Reviews.Content: Be carefull booking a room here. Don't trust the single room pictures on the internet. For about 60 Euro you can have a VERY small single room (no table, no space to walk, just a bed) and the noise is incredable all night long because its in the middle of the red-light district and bar area. People will sit and drink the whole night in front of your window. After one night (without sleep) I asked the money back and was lucky that they made no problems with it. Never saw something like this before.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap(ish) with great location”
Reviews.Author: Mick_Rollingstone
Reviews.Content: I have to start the review by saying that the Hotel Vijaya is not the perfect cosy, plush, hidden gem some of you might be looking for. If luxury is at the top of your list then look elsewhere. However if you are looking to enjoy Amsterdam and want a centrally located room to sleep then the Vijaya fits the bill. There's a great bar next door called The Trinity with a good stretch of canal-side pavement, and within 2 minutes walk you really do have all that you need for a great couple of days. The bedding was clean and the beds comfortable. The shower worked fine although my partner had a problem with the constantly running cistern on the toilet. If you have trouble with steep and winding staircases while carrying your luggage then look elsewhere, but if you want a budget priced hotel in the very center of all the action then I would recommend the Hotel Vijaya. Just decide what you are looking for before booking. It's nowhere near perfect, but it is clean enough and very handy.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've used in Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: DaveSMidlands
Reviews.Content: I'll start this off by just saying that I've used a lot of hotels over the years I've been going to Amsterdam, and this has consistently been the best - probably why I keep going back there. The rooms aren't the biggest, nor are the stairs any different from any other hotel in Amsterdam, but that's Amsterdam for you! Unless you pay a lot more money, and I mean a LOT more money, then I don't think you can do much better than this. Friendly staff, clean rooms, a good breakfast and a nice sized en-suite bathroom as well. If you don't like the hustle and bustle of it's (great) location on the doorstep of the RLD, then take some earplugs, or book somewhere quieter! That said, I've never experienced any undue noise problems or had my sleep disturbed, so there you go. Very close to the station and the majority of the tourist attractions etc. - you can't go wrong. The food in the Indian restaurant downstairs is pretty good too, and you get a discount if you're staying there as well. Top stuff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it seemed!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola00750
Reviews.Content: After catching the train and walking to the hotel, whilst getting slightly lost along the way, Hotel Vijaya actually seemed pretty nice. Yes the stairs are quite daunting, but luckily my friends room was on the ground floor and my room was only one flight of stairs. However, the stairs are very steep and narrow and it seemed easier to crawl up them, rather to walk. The room was cleaned every day, with fresh towels and all the hotel staff seemed very friendly and helped point out good places to go to. There are some pretty nice bars nearby with plenty of coffee shops too. Also about a minutes walk away is a the equivalent of a KFC, but i wouldn't recommend it. On reading most of the reviews for this hotel, it seemed pretty daunting, but actually i couldn't really fault it. We had a good time, and it isn't exactly a five star hotel, but the rooms were nice, with a working tv that actually had english channels. I would stay here again, very central and good for your money!

Reviews.Title: “open 24 hours”
Reviews.Author: chimp900
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vijaya is situated in Amsterdam near the red light district, over the road from Hotel Crown, above some livley bars too and is also an indian resturant. We booked the hotel when we got into Amsterdam...after finding out other prices of hotels nearby! Me and my boyfriend got the room for two nights (Sat&Sun) for 190 Euros which included breckfast and there would be a room change half way through but both rooms had bathrooms inside, but we didnt mind. Also we rememberd to ask if it was a private room as we made the mistake of accepting a shared room earlier that day and quickly getting a refund. The first room had a big bed, a lot of space, a nice size bath room with towels, a wardrobe & cabnets, a tv with programs in English and wide windows letting the sunlight in. The second room was down a long corridor and was smaller but cosy too. The only thing I didnt like about that room was the bathroom, as the toilet was too close facing the wall so it was a bit of a squeeze getting your leggs round! Dont let that put you off though as it was a cosy room, the windows were pull out so we could stick our heads out to see the view of the streets. There was an ash tray in the room so it was easy to smoke without making the room smell! The tables at breckfast were long and layed out neatly with plates, cutlery and spreads they even had mini silver bins for you to put rubbish in! Breckfast consisted of fruit loaf, bread, rolls, criosants, ham, cheese. There was also boiled eggs and museli available and fruit teas, tea & coffee and orange juice. It wasnt the most exiting food but enough to fill you up in the morning. The hotel was 24 hours which was good because we could pop out at anytime and remember hotel owners always see people stoned and drunk in Amsterdam so no matter how hard you try not to giggle as you walk through they will know but wont even bat an eye lid. There were lots of leaflets on things to do in Amsterdam which were helpfull. This was a great hotel but if you get into Amsterdam and need somewhere to stay have a look around no matter how much your getting frustrated with dragging your holdal around as there are many streets close by to the red light district, dam and leisplein! Thanks for reading!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and clean!”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: Friendly clean cheap smoker friendly hotel. Don't stay there if your a yank wanting out of this world service (good luck finding 'service' full stop in Amsterdam!). But if you are looking for a cheap clean central location, this is your stop. I had a lovley window that opened onto the canal and madness below, best smoking spot in town! Perfect thanks! (not sure about the whole restraunt thing though, you'll see if you ever go...)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: britt16
Reviews.Content: Descent Hotel. Great location! Right in the red light district. Breakfast was good. I liked how it was on until 10 am. Staff was friendly . Beds were comfortable. Only strange thing was that we came back to the hotel after a long day and found my underwear and my friends on the floor. That we were sure we did not leave there. A bit strange but other than that it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Dont go here if your a Snob”
Reviews.Author: flick86
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect for a 3night stay!I went here for my 21st birthday with my friend and it was the funniest weekend ever. If you are posh and only love nice hotels then this isnt for you,its very basic and the staircases,oh my god,how steep!as we on the top floor,very hard and funny to get up when your drunk:),we even had to push our suitcases down them on the way home,to get them down. Its right in the middle of amsterdam and 1 of the cheapest hotels too,reception always said hello when you walked in.it was great stuff if you just want a bed with a tv.yes the hotel rooms are small,and have a very small bathroom,makes it more funny.we opened the window one night and then we cudent shut it at all,just glad it didnt rain and we were on the top,We didnt care. Didnt see no mice when i went,but dont think we left any food around. Its good to get a all day tram pass,we ended up in sum weird places,but made it more exciting:). A great and lovely trip,just beileve me and others,dont go here if your posh:)

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: NormalblokeHerts
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few hotels round amsterdam and this is one of the best. You get an en-suite which is very rare for this price. Rooms are small but if you have been to Amsterdam before you know they are all like that. There are added bonuses you don't get in some hotels like the stairs are not to bad which is a case in most hotels and the staff are friendly and if you need anything to drink it is very reasonable. They let you leave your bags there arfter you have checked out and the rooms are cleaned daily, the view over the canal is a bonus and it is not noisy concidering where it is. Enjoyed it so much l am going back there in a week!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and again and again”
Reviews.Author: MillyMorbid
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vijaya is only a 5 minute walk from Centraal station, Smack bang in the middle of The Red Light District and there are tons of Coffee Shops everywhere. The staff were helpful and gave me and my partner a map of the area. The Staff were layed back, I was able to smoke my weed in my hotel room. The room was a little small for a bouble but who cares? thats just a place to sleep after all! The bedding was clean and so were the towels provided, also there was a good supply of toilet paper and 1 soap bar and some shampoo in our hotel. I felt very safe here and cosy in the Vijaya. The breakfast was included in the price, fresh bread rolls, crossents, slices of meat and cheese, boiled eggs, jam, fresh orange juice, tea, coffee etc...it was like a breakfast buffet, you just help yourself. The hotel was open at all times, which is handy if your a party animal and stumble back at the Vijaya hotel at 5 in the morning. The stairs to our room were very steep and long it turned your legs to jelly, but I found this more funny than annoying. Just one down fall - they should of put a 'OUT OF ORDER' sign above the telephone as I wasted a few cents trying to call home. All in all I loved it here, and would definatly stay here again. PS. I read a few posts on here saying that there were smells of cat urine, bugs etc.... I found this not to be true.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: carlosWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stag weekend (4 days) and the vijaya was perfect for all our needs,great location ,clean and tidy & relatively cheap as well.This is not the hotel to take your missus for a nice romantic break,but is great for everything else,Always felt safe very secure which is good seeing as you are right in the middle of the red light district and only a 3 mins walk from central;

Reviews.Title: “Cat house”
Reviews.Author: anondub
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this 'hotel' in a group of about 20. when we arrived there were cats running around everywere and the smell of cat urine was disgusting! on the bright side we were close to everything...we were not expecting much from the reveiews we had read before going but the hotel was actually worse than we expected! non the less we had a great time in amsterdam! This year we will be booking into the botel which is much better and cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: stevinazo
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It is clean. Single. En suite. The only complaint is the free breakfast and for some, that may not be a big deal. It's the typical cold meat and cheese and bread and coffee. Nothing special. Not a deal breaker for me and in fact have chosen to stay here again this coming November. The breakfast at a nearby hotel was superior, but it was not en suite. It's hard to find a decent hotel room for one, but this one is IT! Staff is great. Friendly. Helpful. My favourite part? The church nearby whose bells that plays 'Land of Hope and Glory!'. The location is also great, depending on what you are looking for. It's one block off Warmeostraat, which is usually where I end my nights so it was a nice short walk (stumble) home for me. It's also on a nice quiet canal street. It's close to Centraal as well, which is always nice for arriving and leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrey&Mihaela
Reviews.Content: Crouded hotel with small rooms, beds and the windows have a stupid mecanism and it's hard to close them perfectly down so when it rains you might get wet in the sleep because the bed is under the window. We came there in the afternoon and after we waited for about 30 min we get and payed our room and went to visit the city and in the evening when we came home the hotel manager asked for more money without givind us any explanations. we have the breakfast included but we wait for about 1 hour to get a cup of tea and a biscuit. In conclusion : don't go there

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: kinso89
Reviews.Content: This hotel aint the Hilton and it reflects that in the price you will pay! Its ideal for people just requiring a bed to sleep and basic breakfast! I stayed here with friends for 2 nights and had no problems whatsoever. The hotel is smack bang in the middle of the Red Light District!

Reviews.Title: “much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: inch1975
Reviews.Content: I nearly cried reading the reviews on tripadvisor, 'cos by that time I already booked hotel Vijaya for 5 nights. But... when you expect the worse and receive something decent, your impressions become positive. So are mine about Vijaya. If you book the cheapest hotel in the middle of Red Light District, don't think it will be some schick, luxurious and romantic place. It is not. It's a place for small companies, where you keep your things, wash and change clothes, spend nights and take quick naps. Don't come with kids or for romantic trip (err, depends on your girlfriend of course, but I'd never book anything in this district for myself if going on romance:)) Location: 5-10 minutes to the Central Station, 5-7 minutes to the Dam square, 5 min. to Nieumarkt square. Pretty far from Vondelpark and Museumsplein. Sleep: you'll be able to fall asleep only after 3 a.m., as before that time nearly all crowd willing to see the ----- is crossing the bridge just under your window. From 3 a.m till maybe 10-11 a.m. your sleep will be rarely interrupted by the noise. The canal view from the window (we had a triple room on the 2nd floor) is spectacular. To sit in your own place watching the crowd but not being the part of it is really fun. And (that's important for smokers) - you can smoke in the room whatever your like. The rooms are more than simple, if you ever lived in a 2-star in India - looks like it (besides, Vijaya is owned or managed by people from India, so the likeness is obvious). The shower is a hole in the floor separated from the toilet by some plastic curtain, but even when 3 of us took shower in the morning, the water never flew over the level (as we once had in a two-star in Italy, where after taking a shower you had to swim in the bathroom to use the toilet:)) The towels are changed every day. Bedsheets - on request (in our case it was a note with the tip:)) The mouse: yes, there is a mouse. What do you expect from the 17th century building? It goes out only at night, first scared me to hell as I thought I was hallucinating:)) Regard it as a pet and don't leave food on the table - it will leave your room as soon as there's nothing it can consume. Security: one of the best you can imagine in such a district, though you can't say so from the first glance. To enter the place first you should use the doorbell, then a man at the reception asks your room number and surname and if you by any chance want to invite friends (in our case we needed to take in 6 people), you have to talk to the staff, explain why and how many people are coming and when they are going to leave. We kept our tickets and pretty much money in the safe at the reception (Don't know if there was a safe at all, but they returned the whole thing without troubles:). And everything was OK with our belongings in the room, they never even tried to take euro coins as tip, though we deliberately left it on the beds. Restaurant and breakfast: oops, never had a chance to try it as we were never up before 10:00. There's much places they serve English breakfast in the neighbourhood. So I think that's it. Absolutely OK for that money. Before booking this place, think of the purpose of your trip. For having fun with no pretence for luxury - Vijaya is good.

Reviews.Title: “Did what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: glenbelfast
Reviews.Content: At first i was very depressed and down when reading reviews about this hotel, however when i got there it catered for our stag party needs. The rooms where basic, however we only slept in them. (NO BUGS or RATS as ive read in previous threads.) We had 2 Rooms, a twin and a 5 bed room. on our 1st night the lock broke on our twin room, so the hotel upgraded us to the apartment suite on the top floor(couldn't do enough for us.) We didnt get breakfast in hotel(never up lol) however we did go for our free drink in the hotels restaurant. However if you have trouble getting up and down stairs down go as the stairs are rather steep. Also you could request a ground floor room. As regards to location, its like anywhere in amsterdam you could throw a stone and hit the head of someone trying to sell some illegal goods. Done what we wanted, can't complain

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell”
Reviews.Author: brightyBritain
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel in march 2007. I had made a confirmed booking through Hotel.NTL.com, yet upon arrival was told I would have to pay 100 euros extra for my room because I had not confirmed the booking even though I had a confirmation number in my hand. They then used other excuses such as my credit card had bounced even though payment was to be by cash upon arrival. They also said they had informed me of this by e mail yet somehow the only e.mail received was my confirmation of booking. All in all this hotel is of dubious character. Avoid it totally.You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: LadyJ452
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location - especially if you want a taste of the red light district! I would not recommend coming here with a family. The room was dated, tiny and did not inspire confidence. Also, the stairs are not for the faint hearted! The breakfast was edible, however, compared with other hotels it was not great. If you are on a budget, as we were, I would still stay clear of this place - you will definitely be disappointed. The only plus side was that the location was central. Also, do not expect to get much sleep if you stay here - the street noise is terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Infested with parasitic animals”
Reviews.Author: Sparky53
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a lad's weekend in Amsterdam. Location is good. Rooms are crummy and of very poor quality. They are noisy and very hot in the Summer months. Worst of all 3 out of the 4 of us that stayed in the room caught a parasitic animal from the beds which meant a costly and embarrassing treatment when we got home. Avoid like the plague (or you may catch it).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap,Cheerful and central”
Reviews.Author: gander1888
Reviews.Content: a very average hotel, but what can you expect for the price? Myself and my girlfriend got a very good deal, so i cant really complain about the "averageness" of it, as the rooms were clean, breakfast was decent and we were in a very central location. Bad points would have to come being the stairs, although, being to amsterdam before, most hotels there are the same, high and thin! We paid 160 euro's for a double room for 3 nights B&B. overall i was happy and would go back if i wantded budget accomodation again.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: huntcsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned tonight from Amsterdam. Thankfully we only went for one night! We were staying at hotel Vijaya and the only positive thing is it's excellent location. We arrived at the hotel before the check in time and was told to return in an hour. We then had to wait a further half an hour at reception before the room was ready. We were directed to Room 3 which is outside of the hotel around the back. This is where the wheelie bins and scaffolding resided. Old paint pots sat on the filthy window sills outside. There was no working extractor fan in the shower which meant the steam had nowhere to go, hence the room was damp. We thought the sheets were damp so asked for some more. All our clothes felt damp too. We had to ask for more towels as only two small towels were provided. Not even a simple hook in the shower room to hang the towel up! Breakfast very very basic. Bed side lights not working! Holes in the sheets. Need I go on.... Please don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear”
Reviews.Author: Scattabrainz
Reviews.Content: not only was this hotel as crooked as hell, but it was smelly, dingy, out of condition and the staff were flat out RUDE! I have never been made to feel like such a child. the staff here are very untrusting, barely understand a word of english, and the 'authentic idian they so called offer, is not authentic at all...this hotel is miserable just like the staff, the only plus side was the location. Also, the staff made you leave your keys behind before you went out, this didn't exactly fill me with confidence that my belongings were safe.. basically...STEER CLEAR

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vijaya hotel with my 13year old daughter and we had a great time.The indian restaurant 2 streets away which they own is very good,also the staff were very helpful.Of course it is not 5star but there is so much to do and most of it within walking distance of the hotel all you need is a room to sleep in.The hotel is manned 24hrs and security is good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Joolsey
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! If you can find nowhere else, sleep at the Railway station. It would be quieter. My mother and I had booked through venere months in advance but when we arrived after a full day travelling from Rothenburg in Germany the very rude desk staff told us we were had been quoted too low a price. They demanded full payment in advance and THEN took us to our broom cupboard. We had recently visited Dachau Concentration camp. The rooms were bigger and cleaner there than our room at the Vijaya. I could reach both side walls with arms apart. We had a lovely view of the canal and the noise of the pub/cafee below which began at midnight and went on until 4a.m. the first night and 2 a.m. the next. The breakfasts featured dried-up slices of bread, dried up slices of meat, a minimum number of greyish boiled eggs that quicly ran out and were not replenished. On the third day we wer moved to a larger room higher up but still noisy. The bathroom here stunk and was covered with mould. We gave up for the fourth night and moved to another hotel but we got no refund. By the way a message sent by friends was not passed on to us and they insisted on calling me by my first name. My advice to anyone is steer well clear of this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in a double room overlooking the canal. I stayed for 4 nights. the room was cleaned regularly and the staff was very friendly and helpfull. the breakfeast that is included is a great bonus. It consisted of coffee/tea, breads, cold cuts, hard boiled eggs ect. there was quite a bit of street noise but this should be expected given its prime location right next to the rld. I felt very secure in the hotel. they have a contoled entrace with servailance. overall it is a great choice for those on a budget and interested in a central location to explore all amsterdam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “a bit overpriced but nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a friend for 5 nights in july. 5 minutes walking from Centraal Station. Good location if you like RLD, close to all coffee shops, sex shops & sex shows. A bit pricey considering itÂ´s a very simple, basic hotel: 95 euro/twin room/night. Room was number 3, at the back of hotel, so we had no problems with noise. Facilities: cable tv in room (a lot of channels, but 3 or 4 in english), bathroom with toilet & shower, clean towel & soap everyday except for 1 day... , good continental breakfast (tea, coffee, orange juice, eggs, ham, cheese, bread, butter, jam; from 7:30 to 10am), no lift. Staff friendly. No problems with junkies on the bridge... Ideal for single travellers or small groups of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: vman_xnet
Reviews.Content: Slap bang in the middle of the red light district, a hotel cum indian resurant - But i wouldnt advise eating there!!! The rooms are basic and clean, and good for the price. If you have a hip problem this is not the hotel for you, like most places along the canal front the stairs are steep. But they do have a very good security pass on the door and there is always someone about

Reviews.Title: “Handy spot”
Reviews.Author: Langerfeen
Reviews.Content: Possibly a bit pricey considering the size of the group we were, but that mattered little. The hotel itself was nice. Possibly a bit shabby, but you wont be spending too much time in it anyway. It right in the Red Light which is handy as the best pubs/clubs etc seem to be around there. The showers were nice and hot, the rooms were big and airy (strong radiators as well). Id recommend this to groups of fellas, but somehow I doubt girls would feel as comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “good location in rld”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in April, a nice cheap hotel in the RLD, the staff was nice,the room was cleaned every day and given clean towel and linen. the only negative was that it is a bit rundown and could use a coat of paint. A great place for young or single guys who want to be in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Red Light District and churches”
Reviews.Author: vorona
Reviews.Content: It was unexpecred, but not bad. Very friendly stuff, cheap. clean enough, but noisy - from street. View on channel, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WARNING!!!! This place is DIRTY!!!! Do not stay here! The service was good, continental brekfast ok, but the hotel is nasty. Not once in 4 days did they change our sheets!!! This place is worth 30 euros a night max. HEED MY WARNING!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Banana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Five lads on a long weekend in Amsterdam found The Vijaya hotel to be just the place to stay. You might not take your ladies here but if all you want is a place to rest your head and take a -----, shave and shower then look no further. Staff were very helpful, stored our bags on the final day so we didn't have to carry them around for 8 hours, kept passports in the safe, good continental breakfast. The location is first-class, smack-bang in the middle of the Red Light District. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “great location..great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from a 3 night stay here, the staff were great, the location is brill...the room was very basic but very clean had a great view over the canal..breakfast was everything you could eat and plenty of it well worth the 95 euros for a double room, considering you are not in it very much...the hotel is right on the edge of the RLD so you are in the middle of everthing...have a great time we did.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Vijaya
HotelInfo.Address: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 44, Amsterdam 1012 GE, The Netherlands
